thread.title: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nominees: Janet Jackson, Steve Miller, NWA, more
thread.title_full: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nominees: Janet Jackson, Steve Miller, NWA, more | syracuse.com

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nominees: Janet Jackson, Steve Miller, NWA, more
text:
Some of this year's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nominees are, well, not really "rock and roll."
The Class of 2016 nominations were announced early Thursday morning: Pop singer Janet Jackson; "Straight Outta Compton" rap group N.W.A.; R&B group The Spinners; and funk/disco acts Chaka Khan, The J.B.'s and Chic are up for induction at next year's ceremony.
The rest of the artists on the ballot are much more rock: The Cars, Chicago, Cheap Trick, Deep Purple, Los Lobos, Steve Miller, Nine Inch Nails (NIN) and the Smiths.
According to Rolling Stone , this is the first time Jackson, Khan, Miller, Chicago, Cheap Trick, the Cars, Los Lobos ("La Bamba") and The J.B.'s (James Brown's backing band) have been nominated. Chic is on the ballot for a record 10th time; N.W.A. is being considered for a fourth time.
In order to be eligible for induction this year, artists or bands need to have released their first single or album in 1990 or earlier. Jackson, who just released her 11th studio album, has been eligible for eight years; Cheap Trick, the Cars and Steve Miller Band released their first music in 1978 or earlier.
The public will be able to vote for one of the nominees for induction, along with the more than 800 musicians, historians and industry big wigs that are on the Rock Hall voting committee. From now until December 9, fans can vote on rockhall.com for the "fan's ballot" that will count as one of the ballots for the class of 2016.
The inductees will be announced in December and honored next April at a ceremony that will be broadcast on HBO later in the year.
The most recent Hall of Fame inductees included Green Day, Ringo Star, Joan Jett, Stevie Ray Vaughan and Syracuse University alumnus Lou Reed.
